website_summaries.verdict: A small, but sturdy stainless steel grill spatula at a delightfully low price.
pros: The blade on this spatula is super sturdy, making it great for flipping heavier foods
A beveled edge gives you the ability to chop foods while grilling, and to easily remove seared on foods from the griddle or grill
cons: It is smaller than some of the others and the wooden handle is a bit rough out of the package

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Firm, Probably a "Buy it for Life" type item.
customer_reviews.text: I think it's kind of ridiculous to review a spatula but I wanted to address most of the complaints are utterly worthless, things like "it's too heavy, or it doesn't stand correctly, imbalanced, etc" I just want to say, it's a 7 dollar spatula, stop expecting the world from it. It won't cook for you either. Now onto the review, it's sturdy, firm, not flexible, it fits my hands well, it's flame resistant, it's not heavy (your burgers are just too weak if you're using a flexible one). Like most wood, it's handwash only. Not a problem as it cleaned up with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: A spatula to actually get excited about
customer_reviews.text: I use this every single day. I wanted a spatula as manly as my beard, flannel shirt, and the cast iron skillet I cook every meal on. I wanted the type of spatula that my grand pappy used to use at the deer cabin to make flapjacks for 30 men. This is that spatula ladies and gentlemen. This is the second piece of cookware to have me excited (First being Lodge Cast Iron Skillet). As corny as this sounds, this spatula can be handed down to your grandkids one day, and I plan on doing just that.
customer_reviews.author: Miller Choch

customer_reviews.title: Answer to my cast iron problems!
customer_reviews.text: I recently replaced all the pans in my house with Cast Iron. The plastic utensils just weren't doing it for me anymore (melting blah). Read the reviews on this and figured I didn't have much to lose. It has worked PERFECTLY. I actually really enjoy making omelettes with it. Not only does it do great flipping them over and getting under and around but when I'm finished and I put it on the kids plate the sides cut it into perfect squares for the little guy! Love it! Additionally, this feels very high quality in your hand. It's well balanced and solid. Not flimsy in the slightest. Get it, you'll love it :)
customer_reviews.author: Bridgette

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed to make the best smash burgers
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to make the best smash burgers. No need to ever go to Five Guys, In and Out, Smash Burgers, Shake Shack or any other burger joint. This tool with the beveled edge is perfect for retaining the buttered, seared side of the meat. Turn the blade with the beveled side down, and in one motion get under the buttered sear. Flip the burger normally and you have the best burger anywhere. Well made sturdy product. Will last a lifetime. Very satisfied customer. Five stars
customer_reviews.author: Ketcham

customer_reviews.title: Not good for eggs, a heavy duty piece.
customer_reviews.text: Too thick for eggs, but pretty good for scraping the bottom of cast iron pans. It might also come in handy for killing zombies. This edge is serious business.
customer_reviews.author: Saturniidae

customer_reviews.title: 10 + stars
customer_reviews.text: 10 + This product is great. Durable handle. Durable blade with excellent beveled edges. Blade so strong it works great on cast iron skillets. And the price is increadible. Note, if you buy the 3 pack on amazon you pay a couple bucks more. Buy them single and get more than one if desired.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Sharp edges will dig right into non stick coating on coated pans.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the look and feel of this spatula. It is heavy and seems to be made of quality metal. The only drawback is the edge on them that can be seen in the picture. While that edge is great for scooping up things, it also digs right into the non stick coating on coated pans. I have to be very careful when using it or it will scrape some of the non stick coating right off the pan in and right into my food. They should probably recommend this spatula for cast iron or all metal pans right in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: Very well built
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This spatula was quite inexpensive, so I figured I’d give it a try. I was very pleasantly surprised with how durable and well built this spatula is. It weighs 6.7oz. Great purchase! Glad I ordered one
customer_reviews.author: J.G.

customer_reviews.title: This thing Kicks A**
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually get too excited about kitchen utensils. But this thing really kicks butt. It's solid, a great edge for scraping things off pans or the grill. It's heavy enough that it sits flat, with no chance of falling over. I use it on cast iron that plastic utensils cannot handle ( the edges break off). Whether mashing down burgers or scraping things out of pans this thing is my go to utensil. And the price is the icing on the cake.
customer_reviews.author: flyboy

customer_reviews.title: fantastic flipper, hefty, helpful tool, great value
customer_reviews.text: The "Winco TN719 Blade Hamburger Turner, 6-Inch by 3-Inch" is a solid, well-made kitchen tool. The large flipper size is great for turning omelets, steaks. fish, pancakes and other foods. The wooden handle allows a good grip and stays cool. I use my cast iron skillets a lot for preparing a variety of dishes, and this is the perfect spatula for metal pans or grills. The shape and construction of the tool is also great for cutting and serving foods such as lasagna, casseroles, brownies, and marshmallow cereal treats directly from the pan. It is easy to clean, and I use it almost every day. Excellemt value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase for my Lodge skillet
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing i could have ever gotten for my cast iron skillet. It's sturdy. It's just the right size for smashing, scrambling, stirring, folding, etc. I hand wash mine as soon as I'm done using it but that's because i prefer to. I feel that not throwing it in the dishwasher will help it last longer. It cleans so easily that there's no need to have it in all that water for that long of a time frame. I've seen these go for as much as $25. Be aware that you're paying for the name and the advertising. This is an awesome product and a great gift!
customer_reviews.author: beachlover0727

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bargain!! Not for use in dishwasher! Not for use in non-stick cookware!
customer_reviews.text: After reading some reviews, its obvious that some reviewers are ill educated on wood handled utensils. Wood handled utensils Are NOT dishwasher safe. Detergents and the high heat w/humidity;destroys the bonding agents,finish and causes the wood to swell/split. This is common sense folks. Other than people mistreating the spatula, its Fantastic! Perfect & Ideal for Iron Cookware! Hell, its perfect size for my 100+ year old 8" skillet & sirloin sizzler. Do not use this in non-stick cookware!!! You will immediately regret it. But again, that's common sense... I'm ordering another and the size larger , for my grill/smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin N.

customer_reviews.title: Is this thing supposed to be for a DOLLHOUSE?  VERY VERY TINY!
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived today and I didn't even bother opening the bubblewrap (they didn't put it in a box to protect it). It's so small that I guess you could use it to flip tiny slider sized burgers or possibly some silver dollar sized pancakes. WAY WAY too small for flipping burgers and the like. Trying to get a return so I can get a human sized spatula instead, but Amazon said that it isn't eligible for return. I've written the seller to see if they will RMA it, not heard back yet.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this turner. I wanted something well-made to use for eggs and everyday frying—not too big and not too small. This is the perfect size, has a bit of heft to it, the handle fits my hand nicely. The beveled edge on three sides will make it nice to turn eggs!
customer_reviews.author: cheriwinkle

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the 1st metal spatula I bought at least once a week for about 42 years that finally the handle wore out and and broke at the bend and knew I wouldn't find another to last as long. I was wrong. This is it. It's way heavier that it looks in the photo and by heavy I mean it feels like quality and this one will last as long as the 1st one I bought. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: P.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a rock
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy beyond expectation... you need to scrape a cast iron skillet? Get this. It works for flipping pancakes and fried eggs very well. There is no discernible flexibility so food weight is not an issue. I'm going to get a slightly smaller one to go with it just because this one is so impressive. It also slides well behind my magnetic knife rack so it is ready to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mys

customer_reviews.title: Don’t. Just don’t. My review below provides details
customer_reviews.text: There is a sticker on the back of the spatula and the adhesive will NOT come off. I soaked it in water for 48 hours and the base of the adhesive is still there. So unless I want my food to taste like glue, it’s garbage. Also, it cannot be put in the dishwasher. Put it in there as a desperate attempt to remove the glue and now the handle has splinters
customer_reviews.author: Gina Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Too thick
customer_reviews.text: Nice spatula, but I was searching for one that was thin enough to really slide under eggs and pancakes without it ruining the food. This spatula isn't thin enough, it's way too thick, tried flipping an egg, but couldn't even get the spatula under the egg without slicing into the egg yolk. It might be good for a steak or thicker slabs of meat, but I wouldn't even use it for that.
customer_reviews.author: moonstar

customer_reviews.title: Durability with clean lines.
customer_reviews.text: Now understand I bought this spatula for one reason and that was to break in my new cast iron skillet!!! I can't find one thing wrong with this product. I purposely bought this item to break in my new Lodge cast iron skillet and I'll tell ya after 20 uses on steak, burgers, eggs, vegetables you name it this spatula is still in beautiful shape and definitely takes the beating I intended for it. I generally purchase made in USA when I can but for the price I had to try this item. Like I said I bought it to destroy it!!!!! But it looks like this will be used on many cast iron skillets to come!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Estrada

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty but such a great tool!
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to tell the quality of this by the look of the pictures, but other reviews were so spot on when they said that this thing feels professional. It has just the right weight to it. It is easily washable and I can see this lasting many years without it looking like it is getting beat up. I’d highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wasserman

customer_reviews.title: Super stout!
customer_reviews.text: Never thought I'd write a review for a spatula, but this deserves one. What a durable kitchen tool! The steel is strong, doesn't flex much - perfect for smash burgers! I did have to file off a small burr on one of the corners before using, but that's no big deal. The tool is stout, handle is nice, and the head is beveled on all three sides. Really great value! Get you one!
customer_reviews.author: The consumer's voice

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: This spatula has been used now for about a month and it is still good as new. It has a nice solid weight and stands on its own without tipping back. I have washed it and left to dry on the dish rack and it has not rusted. I do not use a dishwasher. It has a nice thin edge that allows to really scrape up underneath whatever you are cooking (in my case, pupusas). Don't hesitate and buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Liz Argueta

customer_reviews.title: Some good, some bad
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to clean. When food gets stuck to the spatula, I really have to scrub hard to get it off. Also, the handle feels rough, and like it could splinter. It does a good job at scooping up eggs and burgers on my cast iron skillet. Not the best or most elegant untensil I've ever owned. Not terrible though.
customer_reviews.author: Moon StarsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Much better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bough this to use on my cast iron skillets. You can tell as soon as you pick this thing up that it is sturdy and well built. It is weighted so that it will sit flat when set down. It's hard to get too excited about a spatula, but this one is very nice, and will last forever. It is an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: MachMyDay

customer_reviews.title: Awesome spatula
customer_reviews.text: This is larger than I thought it would be and really nice and thick. I love it. I was using a mini one in my cast iron pan and saw this one and decided with such a decent price to try it. It's awesome, I love the feel of it. It works great in my pan, totally recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Blessed Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Durable turner, hand wash only!
customer_reviews.text: Durable handle and blade. I purchased this prior to a barbecue event that has me slated as the main cook. Flipping burgers on a large trailer-style flat grill top was simple and fun with this turner. I’d recommend for both home and commercial use. The quality and durability seems like the turner would fare well in a commercial environment. I do recommend washing this turner by hand, due to the wood handle.
customer_reviews.author: Podaso

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Spatula
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived today and it is exactly what I hoped for. I already used it on a charcoal grill and a cast iron skillet. It is superb on a grill, but could be a tad large for a skillet depending on the size of said skillet and/or personal preference. I think my skillet is 10 inches, and I don’t think anything smaller than that would be a great fit for this spatula. The spatula itself tho is very sturdy. It can be flexed slightly if you really try to intentionally do so, but besides that it is pretty much rigid as can be. I never expected to find a spatula exactly how I wanted it, at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty spatula
customer_reviews.text: We received the spatula and it immediately felt heavy at first touch. It has a nice weight to it and seems like it will last a long time. Only gave 4 stars for durability since it's brand new. I will try to update that once we've been using it for a long time. Definitely seems like a great value for under $10.
customer_reviews.author: Eunicom

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this again!
customer_reviews.text: An extremely sturdy, heavy duty turner that I use a lot with my cast iron cooking. The blade is very solid and is thinner at the very edge to get under your food. The long side of it is almost sharp and I use it for cutting the food if needed. Excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Webfoot

customer_reviews.title: Hefty, hardy, and Excellent Quality for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty amazed when this heavy duty spatula arrived. I bought it to replace a similar one I bought at a bargain store a couple years ago that had finally snapped at the fold line where the metal turns upwards toward the handle. This spatula will never snap, I can already tell! It's built like a piece of armor and at least twice as thick as my old one. I use it with my cast iron cookware. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Brenna

customer_reviews.title: Must have in the kitchen or at the grill
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Forget all the silicone and plastic imposters. These are great for frying, grilling, or serving. Pro quality, very rigid and easy to clean. Great for scraping griddles or flat tops off as you cook. I wish I found it years ago.
customer_reviews.author: B a r r y

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Winco Metal Spatula
customer_reviews.text: This Winco Stainless Steel spatula (flipper) is excellent and exactly as described. It is very heavy duty and well-made of quality materials. It has beveled edges on all sides and is very sturdy. Very happy with this item and you will be too.
customer_reviews.author: Merle Kruger

customer_reviews.title: Top-quality spatula
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reading a Blog on how to make the world's best burger, and I thought at the time that it was unlikely that a spatula could really affect burger quality, but this allows you to smash a burger flat like they do at Steak n' Shake. I have been very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R. Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous!
customer_reviews.text: Based on the reviews I expected a nice, solid spatula, but this tool is absolutely beautiful! Everything in the drawer looks shabby and flimsy by comparison. The metal is heavy and every part is well finished, the sharp, bevel edge is great, and it all feels well balanced the hand. This is gift worthy, and I expect to enjoy using it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hersh

customer_reviews.title: Solid for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed is my initial impression. Just got 2 of them, handles are tight, nice weight, feels good in the hand. Stainless steel seems quite nice actually. I was a little concerned as it is made in China. Seems pretty nice. As of right now, it is perfect for a cheap spatula. I doubt the quality would be better coming from a different country. We'll see if it rusts. . . (Stainless steel won't. . . but cheap stuff will)
customer_reviews.author: Justin Engles

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: It rusted a bit after my first use, but I attribute that more to my inability to clean dishes in a timely manner. The steel is quite thick and the edges taper down to a decently sharp edge, making it easy to lift stuck food. This would be perfect if it had a longer handle.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Super well built
customer_reviews.text: You won’t find a better turner for the price, I’ve looked. My only complaint is that it’s square and not round which makes things a bit tough getting out of my skillet but it’s advertised as clearly squared so I won’t hold that against them
customer_reviews.author: coolinst

customer_reviews.title: A must have for every kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy, sharp, well made, all around classic stainless steel spatula great for use with cast iron or stainless steel cook wear. I was tired of my flimsy plastic spatulas that could never get the bottom layer of eggs off the pan before they overcooked, or even flip a burger without it falling apart. This spatula is amazing. I know now why my mom always had one of these in her drawer!
customer_reviews.author: HBaird

customer_reviews.title: Overall pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This was bigger and heavier than I expected, but the quality is good. I like the shape of it and it works well. The only reason I gave it four stars is that you can't lay it on the counter without the metal pulling it down, so if it has food on it the food gets onto the counter. I had a similar spatula that would lay in an upward angle to keep the counter clean.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Ruocco

customer_reviews.title: Very solid and well made
customer_reviews.text: Very well built and solid wood handled turner. This is a great flipper and works really well. We use this for cooking on our cast iron griddle, for making smash burgers and for cooking all sort of burgers and cheese steaks. has a really nice beveled edge and is a solid feeling flipper that is not flimsy at all. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pancakes
customer_reviews.text: I use this turner with my cast iron pans and is the perfect pancake flipper. It easily gets under my pancakes and makes flipping them a breeze. the turner is well constructed, and is not flimsy. If you are looking for a flexible spatula, this isn't for you. The rigidity of the blade is what makes this perfect for pancakes, as well as heavier items (meats).
customer_reviews.author: BryD

customer_reviews.title: Great for cooking out
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. The handle is a bit rough and could have used some sort of finish, because it almost feels like you could get a splinter from it after a bit of normal wear.
customer_reviews.author: JanetteTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Wow, great heavy duty utensile.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our camping trips but have added it to our in home kitchen as one of my favorite spatulas. This is one heavy duty item. Love it. Makes the best smash burgers.
customer_reviews.author: Paula M.

customer_reviews.title: Would be perfect if only balance were not off
customer_reviews.text: A great turner as long as you don't mind that, because of the way the tool is balanced, the blade will always sit flat on your surface. It gets dirty and so will whatever surface you set it on.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty - Great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great turner/scraper for your flat top grill. Thick & solid stainless steel blade. Wood handle is a little rough. I intend to buy another one. I do not think you can come close to the price for the quality you get.
customer_reviews.author: coedriver

customer_reviews.title: nice product
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and heavy. Very good quality spatula. In case you were wondering though, this is too small to do smashburgers. Winco makes a larger one which is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but not the best
customer_reviews.text: The blade is short. It is thick and the handle looks to be strong. But with the blade being so short it doesn’t flip a lot food. Not bad for a steak or chops but for hash browns it sucks
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Best metal spatula I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Straight up - It's the best metal spatula I've ever even held. It's sturdy, it's easy to clean, and it holds up extremely well to heat. I've cooked over open fire, the grill, and of course the stovetop with this spatula. There is literally no visible wear, and I think this will last me another 30 years as long as I don't lose it first.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Teall

customer_reviews.title: Great value, very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is sturdy and similar to what you see chefs in restaurants using. I will use this whole cooking with my cast irons. Can't believe it was only 5 bucks!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn J

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for, better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, thick, heavy blade. Just what I was looking for. Perfect for grilling burgers, flipping eggs and pancakes. Quality exceeded my expectations given the low price.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, but if I had to do it again, I would look into getting a larger spatula
customer_reviews.text: I bought the spatula specifically for smash burgers. While yes, it does smash, I wish I purchased a larger one because this spatula only covers part of the patty when I'm smashing a beef ball about 1/4 to a 1/3 lb.
customer_reviews.author: GDubya

customer_reviews.title: You will be a Grill MASTER !!
customer_reviews.text: Shipped quickly, this spatula/turner is on the small size, perfect for hamburgers. I never thought I needed one this size until I got this. It does put your hand a bit closer to the grill or griddle, but it handles small items better than a large spatula and therefore it's less likely you'll drop the food. Burgers are easy to flip with it, onions, pineapple rings, veggies a cinch to turn. Well made, nice wooden handle. No complaints. Would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Art and Soul

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Kitchen Tool But...
customer_reviews.text: The weight and feel of this spatula are fantastic but I wish the handle was weighted differently so it stayed down and the blade end stayed elevated when sitting on counter. No complaints about quality though...excellent.
customer_reviews.author: JE

customer_reviews.title: Cookie Turner
customer_reviews.text: I know it reads as a "hamburger turner", but with the beveled edge, I use it for removing cookies from the cookie sheets. My 1st one lasted about 5 years until I used it for a screw driver (my bad), and it didn't have a smooth edge after that. The cookies come off the pan without scratching the pans, or squishing the cookies. I really do recommend this turner.
customer_reviews.author: Dorie M

customer_reviews.title: Almost great
customer_reviews.text: For the price its a good deal on a metal spatula. The only complaint? The wood and metal handle are not that tight. Theres an ever so slight rattle because of the space. Not too much of an issue. Just slightly annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Customer McCustomerface

customer_reviews.title: Simple, straight forward turner, suitable for cast-iron pans
customer_reviews.text: Cheap $5 turner/scraper that replaced a rusty metal spatula i had that i loved for scraping down bits on my cast-iron pan. Has a hefty weight to it with sharp edges. keeps my cast iron smooth and flat without ripping off layers of seasoning. watch the edges though on the curved sides of lodge pans, as the sharpness can cut into it.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon Abrazado

customer_reviews.title: Can't be beat for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great burger blade, I use it for anything I'm grilling. Easily worth more than what I paid for it, cheap simple and solid construction. Only gripe is the handle is a little too short and your hand feels the heat over a hot grill. Definitely recommend regardless.
customer_reviews.author: ZEPHYR534

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, heavy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, big, firm spatula. It is heavy, and you need to make sure you don't drop it (on your foot, it has sharp edges). Nicely priced.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannine R

customer_reviews.title: This is the best spatula I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: Low price, high quality spatula. Best I've ever used and I've used a lot! Get rid of your flimsy silicones and plastics. This is a cook's dream.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Roman

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction
customer_reviews.text: I got it for everyday use in the kitchen. It has a solid construction, great wood handle, heavy and sturdy. Not flimsy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tristanicus

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based on a review on Wirecutter. It is super heavy (in a good way) and the edge is sharp enough to pull up even stuck food. Fantastic value for 5 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Cast-iron griddle, ground short ribs, and the spatula makes for a great smash burger... I have no more to say. Just try it...
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Great Kitchen Tool
customer_reviews.text: An excellent kitchen tool. I use this as an everyday spatula; it's never seen a burger despite it's name as a "hamburger turner." The beveled front edge is wonderfully sharp for getting under food or scraping the pan. I was surprised how heavy this spatula is; it can start to feel a little overly heavy if you're using it for prolonged periods, but that's my only complaint about it.
customer_reviews.author: Smaug

customer_reviews.title: great spatula
customer_reviews.text: the only thing i dislike is the wooden handle, not diswasher safe, and when wet it feels like old splintery wood, dont get me wrong no splinters, just the way it feels when wet
customer_reviews.author: s.riddles

customer_reviews.title: Way more than a spatula
customer_reviews.text: This is a dream come true for my large cast iron skillets. Too large and heavy to use for any pan less than about 8", at least in my amateur hands. Sharp edges seem like they will hold up well. Incredible value for what I paid. More potatoes, anyone?
customer_reviews.author: A Dexter

customer_reviews.title: Great for flipping those burgers
customer_reviews.text: Love this for grilling. Price is great. We purchased one for home and one for the camp. Very sturdy product
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great spatula for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Very robust. Beveled edge is very sharp and is great for sliding under food in the pan. There is virtually no bending, or flex, in this spatula. It stands on it's own on the flat part of the spatula. Works awesome in our cast iron skillet. This will work great on our small bar-b-que grill also. The plastic spatulas are junk for use in cast iron. Do not use this in a teflon type coated pans.
customer_reviews.author: KSB NC

customer_reviews.title: bigger than I thought, heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: I never look at dimensions (my bad!) so this is larger than I expected, but well made. The handle had some wood splinters in the split part but not a huge deal. The metal spatula is much thicker than I was anticipating, and I would prefer a thinner metal for things like cutting brownies. It probably works great for burgers.
customer_reviews.author: Delayed Gratification

customer_reviews.title: Great turner, good quality
customer_reviews.text: No rust on first wash, very heavy duty and durable. Turner angled downward at edges to help scooping. Handle is soft wood.
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Handle
customer_reviews.text: Way more hard core than I expected for the price. We bought to use with our camping gear on our cast iron skillet. My husband quickly confiscated it and added it to our regular kitchen use drawer. We use it on all our cast iron stuff. It doubles as a scraper for the tough stuff too!
customer_reviews.author: S. Andrade

customer_reviews.title: Used on Jenn Are Griddle
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for use with my Jenn Are built in Griddle. Works fantastic. Use it every morning for breakfast. Eggs, sausage, pancakes you name it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I think I'll buy another
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about this little flipper. Esp how it stands up all by itself on the blade.
customer_reviews.author: joedit

customer_reviews.title: Rusts in dishwasher
customer_reviews.text: This is listed as stainless steel but it rusts everytime I put it in the dishwasher. But the price was nice. I bought it for camping and it suffices for that. Rust may be cleaned off with Bar Keepers friend.
customer_reviews.author: D. Otts

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a spatula for cooking on the cast iron. This is great for that. I like the sharp edges, good for scraping.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley G Moody

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Based on the low price, I was pleasantly surprised by the substantial quality of this item. It feels very heavy in your hand. I bought them to use when serving Sicilian style pizza out of a deep sheet pan, and I love that the edge on all three sides is tapered enough that you can cut with it, yet not sharp enough to hurt you.
customer_reviews.author: tallguy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Professional Spatula
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this spatula after our nylon one melted while making pancakes. This one has a great sharp edge that makes getting under food incredibly easy and is super sturdy and durable. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Most excellent kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: Boy oh boy did this bring back the memories of working as a fry cook. Totally excellent tool: it is heavy, well made and totally balanced. I love how nice it is to use with my iron skillet. I still can't believe I paid what I did for it. This looks like a most excellent Christmas gift for a number of folk who love to grill and really appreciate their tools.
customer_reviews.author: Bydnmytime

customer_reviews.title: The right size
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my stainless steel grill flipping burgers and making grill cheese, heavy, sturdy, wide, good price.
customer_reviews.author: Danala Curley

customer_reviews.title: Not quite what I hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: Finish on handle didn't weather the dish washer well, but the quality of the metal is fine and the product is very servicable.
customer_reviews.author: LfritzW

customer_reviews.title: Great product for an amazing price!!! Must get!
customer_reviews.text: Love this for burger and so much more ! Even a food mover after slicing veggies or fruit or anything! Very versatile !!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa G

customer_reviews.title: Handles are NOT DISHWASHER SAFE!
customer_reviews.text: Quality of steel is ok, but handle color & finish are completely GONE after a single trip through a dishwasher. Cracking/spitting BADLY after 3 washes. Hand wash these only.
customer_reviews.author: Jim The Pro Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Super Blade Turner
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why it is so hard to fine this turner. I could not find it in any stores, but by chance I came across it on Amazon. It is the best thing to use for flipping anything, burgers, eggs, French toast burgers, etc. What makes it special is the beveled edge. Most turners you see do not have that edge. That's what makes it ease to flip food. Thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Reiss

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for grilling out
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for grilling. I hate those super long handled grilling utensils.
customer_reviews.author: NewMidwesterner

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this turner specifically for making smash burgers after I bent another spatula. This thing is super solid and allows you to really lean into it. It could stand to be a little wider for smashing big burger patties, but otherwise it feels perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Luddy

customer_reviews.title: Great for cast iron
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. The handle has a rough finish after washing but still worth the price. I ash by hand.
customer_reviews.author: JLGMontana

customer_reviews.title: The Abrams tank of spatulas
customer_reviews.text: Heavy metal makes this a great scraper tool. Heavy metal also makes it unbalanced and so a little awkward to hand. Seems to have been engineered in the Harley-Davidson manner: if it breaks, make it thicker.
customer_reviews.author: BLS

customer_reviews.title: Smash burger must have
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Only issue I have is it started to rust a bit but I cleaned it up and love how will it works on cast iron and for smash burgers
customer_reviews.author: Gaetano

customer_reviews.title: Love This for My Cast Iron!
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you dry it thoroughly and you won't have rust problems.
customer_reviews.author: Countess Aurelia

customer_reviews.title: Substantially made and perfect for turning and flattening hamburgers, bacon, etc
customer_reviews.text: Substantially made and perfect for turning and flattening hamburgers, bacon, etc. Has a hefty feel to it and looks great
customer_reviews.author: marlis

customer_reviews.title: Solid Turner
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected however I already feel some looseness in the handle after only a few months and have only hand washed it. I would have preferred rounded corners--if you plan on using this in a round pan I would get something else to avoid scratches and difficulty getting everything out.
customer_reviews.author: TucBrewer

customer_reviews.title: Quality steel, real wood handle, solid construction
customer_reviews.text: Great spatula. Quality steel. Real wood handle. I laser engraved the handles and they made great Christmas gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Pampered Chef one it replaced, but cheaper.
customer_reviews.text: The actual spatula is exactly the same as a pampered chef one, but the tang is a litter wider and sturdier. The handle is wood instead of plastic, too.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Very handy and easy to keep clean.
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that it is nice and sturdy for cooking. I dislike the plastic ones. They melt and you can’t keep them clean.
customer_reviews.author: Dolores T.

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect, it's $6, you can't go wrong! I want to order 3 more of them!
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect, it's $6, you can't go wrong! I want to order 3 more of them!
customer_reviews.author: Maxfield Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Best add-on ever!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. I can make the best smash burgers with this baby! Love it! If you have a kitchen and you don't have one of these you really don't have a kitchen! I can't believe it's $2. Seems like a $30 product!
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS SPAT
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS SPAT!! JUST LIKE THE ONE I USED AT THE MYRTLE BEACH PAVILION 50 YEARS AGO !! THIS IS A GREAT PRO BURGER FLIPPER SPAT & AND YOU CANNOT BUY IN A STORE !!!
customer_reviews.author: Ray Drayton                                             Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome turner
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a new hamburger turner. The price of this caught my eye - user reviews are good. All I can say is - wow! This is a high quality turner and is heavy. I'm using this with my cast iron skillets and absolutely love it. Some reviews said its for the grill - it could work out there, but works great with my cast irons!
customer_reviews.author: Steakman

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect. Exactly what I was thinking I wanted. The price was great too.
customer_reviews.author: Randyman

customer_reviews.title: Works for smash burgers
customer_reviews.text: Good. Not super sturdy but enough to squash a burger.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Sent me the wrong size, won't allow me to return it.
customer_reviews.text: It says 6x3 inches but I got a 5x2.5 inch spatula. Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Taylor
